hero.headline: OpenAI's GPT-5.1-Codex-Max Arrives: Fastest Frontier Coding Model Now in GitHub Copilot
hero.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5.1-Codex-Max, their new frontier agentic coding model built on an updated reasoning foundation. The model is faster, more intelligent, and more token-efficient at every stage of development. As of December 4, it's rolling out to GitHub Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise users.
hero.whyItMatters: This marks a significant leap for AI-assisted coding. GPT-5.1-Codex-Max includes native Windows support (a first for Codex models), extra-high reasoning effort mode for complex tasks, and is now the default in the Codex CLI. The model is also available in Cursor, Linear, and other tools via API access.

topStories.title: Docker MCP Toolkit: 170+ AI Tools Now One Command Away
topStories.summary: Docker released their MCP Toolkit with over 170 pre-built Model Context Protocol servers. From databases to APIs to dev tools, you can now add powerful AI integrations with a single 'mcp-add' command. Early adopters report it solves 90% of AI coding integration challenges.

topStories.title: Claude Opus 4.5 Gets Expanded Access: Removed Caps for Claude Code Users
topStories.summary: Anthropic removed Opus-specific rate limits for Claude Code users. Max and Team Premium users now receive roughly the same Opus token allocation they previously had with Sonnet. Pro users can purchase extra usage for Opus 4.5 access.

topStories.title: Basecamp Drops Fizzy: A Fresh Take on Kanban Boards
topStories.summary: Basecamp released Fizzy, their new open-source Kanban tool with 829 GitHub stars on day one. Built with Ruby, it promises 'Kanban as it should be, not as it has been.' The team behind Basecamp and Hey is betting on simplicity over feature bloat.

topStories.title: Next-AI-Draw-IO: Create Diagrams with Natural Language
topStories.summary: A new Next.js app integrates AI capabilities with draw.io, letting you create and modify diagrams through natural language commands. Already trending with 508 stars, it's perfect for architects and developers who think in visuals but hate manual diagramming.

highlights: New --agent CLI flag to override agent settings for current session
Added agent setting to configure main thread with specific system prompt and tool restrictions
Pro subscribers now have access to Opus 4.5 as part of their subscription
Built-in holiday theme for seasonal customization
Just-in-time context manager for improved token efficiency
System instruction adaptations for Gemini 3.0 compatibility
GPT-5.1-Codex-Max is now the default model with extra-high reasoning mode
New /resume slash command for continuing previous sessions
History trimming via history.max_bytes for better performance

notableQuotes.quote: Claude Code reached $1 billion in run-rate revenue in only 6 months.
notableQuotes.author: Mike Krieger

notableQuotes.quote: Prompt engineering is very much aliveâ€”and more important than ever. If anything, it's become more critical as companies rely on LLMs to drive user-facing features and core functionality.
notableQuotes.author: Sander Schulhoff

notableQuotes.quote: A single malicious file could compromise an entire development environment. When a developer clones the repository and runs Codex, the tool automatically executes embedded commands without warnings.
notableQuotes.author: Check Point Research

prompt: Daily AI news digest generated by fetching from personal-homepage API feed, web searches for Claude Code/Gemini CLI/OpenAI Codex December 2025 news, trending GitHub repos via trotd, changelogs from all three tools, SkillsMP Claude skills feed, Docker MCP catalog, and YouTube trending API. Compiled into structured JSON with Anthropic's Bun acquisition as hero story, tool updates, trending skills, MCP servers, videos, and quotes for prompt engineering audience.
